uk.co.caprica.vlcj.player

Class MediaPlayerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.caprica.vlcj.player.MediaPlayerFactory

  • public class MediaPlayerFactory
extends Object
    Factory for media player instances.

    The factory initialises a single libvlc instance and uses that to create media player instances.

    If required, you can create multiple factory instances each with their own libvlc options.

    You should release the factory when your application terminates to properly clean up native resources.

    The factory also provides access to the native libvlc Logger and other resources such as the list of audio outputs, and the list of available audio and video filters.

    Usage: 

       // Set some options for libvlc
   String[] libvlcArgs = {...add options here...};

   // Create a factory instance (once), you can keep a reference to this
   MediaPlayerFactory mediaPlayerFactory = new MediaPlayerFactory(libvlcArgs);

   // Create a full-screen strategy
   FullScreenStrategy fullScreenStrategy = new DefaultFullScreenStrategy(mainFrame);

   // Create a media player instance
   EmbeddedMediaPlayer mediaPlayer = mediaPlayerFactory.newEmbeddedMediaPlayer(fullScreenStrategy);

   // Do some interesting things with the media player, like setting a video surface...

   ...

   // Release the media player
   mediaPlayer.release();

   // Release the factory
   factory.release();
    You must make sure you keep a hard reference to the media player (and possibly other) objects created by this factory. If you allow a media player object to go out of scope, then unpredictable behaviour will occur (such as events no longer seeming to fire) even though the video playback continues (since that happens via native code). You may also likely suffer fatal JVM crashes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MediaPlayerFactory

        public MediaPlayerFactory()
        Create a new media player factory.

        If you want to enable logging or synchronisation of the native library interface you must use MediaPlayerFactory(LibVlc) and LibVlcFactory.

        This factory constructor will enforce a minimum required native library version check - if a suitable native library version is not found a RuntimeException will be thrown.

        If you do not want to enforce this version check, use one of the other constructors that accepts a LibVlc instance that you obtain from the LibVlcFactory.

      • MediaPlayerFactory

        public MediaPlayerFactory(String... libvlcArgs)
        Create a new media player factory.

        If you want to enable logging or synchronisation of the native library interface you must use MediaPlayerFactory(LibVlc) and LibVlcFactory.

        This factory constructor will enforce a minimum required native library version check - if a suitable native library version is not found, a RuntimeException will be thrown.

        If you do not want to enforce this version check, use one of the other constructors that accepts a LibVlc instance that you obtain from the LibVlcFactory.

        Most initialisation arguments may be gleaned by invoking "vlc -H".

        Parameters:
        libvlcArgs - initialisation arguments to pass to libvlc

      • MediaPlayerFactory

        public MediaPlayerFactory(LibVlc libvlc)
        Create a new media player factory.

        Use LibVlcFactory to get a reference to the native library.

        Parameters:
        libvlc - interface to the native library

        libvlcArgs - initialisation arguments to pass to libvlc

      • MediaPlayerFactory

        public MediaPlayerFactory(List<String> libvlcArgs)
        Create a new media player factory.

        This is simply an alternate constructor for convenience, see MediaPlayerFactory(String...).

        Parameters:
        libvlcArgs - initialisation arguments to pass to libvlc, may be empty but must not be null

        Parameters:

        libvlcArgs - initialisation arguments to pass to libvlc, may be empty but must not be null

      • getAudioOutputs

        public List<AudioOutput> getAudioOutputs()
        Get the available audio outputs.

        Each audio output has zero or more audio devices, each device having it's own unique identifier that can be used on a media player to set the select the required output device.

        Returns:
        collection of audio outputs

      • newEmbeddedMediaPlayer

        public EmbeddedMediaPlayer newEmbeddedMediaPlayer()
        Create a new embedded media player.

        Full-screen will not be available, to enable full-screen support see newEmbeddedMediaPlayer(FullScreenStrategy), or use an alternate mechanism to manually set full-screen if needed.

        Returns:
        media player instance

      • newEmbeddedMediaPlayer

      • newDirectMediaPlayer

        @Deprecated
public DirectMediaPlayer newDirectMediaPlayer(int width,
                                                int height,
                                                RenderCallback renderCallback)
        Deprecated. use newDirectMediaPlayer(BufferFormatCallback, RenderCallback) instead
        Create a new direct video rendering media player with a pixel format suitable for, amongst other things, rendering into a BufferedImage.

        The pixel format used is "RV32" (a raw RGB format with padded alpha) and the pitch is width*4.

        Parameters:
        width - width for the video
        height - height for the video
        renderCallback - callback to receive the video frame data
        Returns:
        direct media player implementation

      • newDirectMediaPlayer

        @Deprecated
public DirectMediaPlayer newDirectMediaPlayer(String format,
                                                int width,
                                                int height,
                                                int pitch,
                                                RenderCallback renderCallback)
        Deprecated. use newDirectMediaPlayer(BufferFormatCallback, RenderCallback) instead
        Create a new direct video rendering media player.
        Parameters:
        width - width for the video
        height - height for the video
        format - pixel format (e.g. RV15, RV16, RV24, RV32, RGBA, YUYV)
        pitch - pitch, also known as stride
        renderCallback - callback to receive the video frame data
        Returns:
        media player instance

      • newDirectMediaPlayer

        public DirectMediaPlayer newDirectMediaPlayer(BufferFormatCallback bufferFormatCallback,
                                     RenderCallback renderCallback)
        Create a new direct video rendering media player.
        Parameters:
        bufferFormatCallback - callback to set the desired buffer format
        renderCallback - callback to receive the video frame data
        Returns:
        media player instance

      • newHeadlessMediaPlayer

        public HeadlessMediaPlayer newHeadlessMediaPlayer()
        Create a new headless media player.

        The head-less player is intended for audio media players or streaming server media players and may spawn a native video player window unless you set proper media options when playing media.

        Returns:
        media player instance

      • getMediaMeta

        public MediaMeta getMediaMeta(String mediaPath,
                     boolean parse)
        Get local media meta data.

        Note that requesting meta data may cause one or more HTTP connections to be made to external web-sites to attempt download of album art.

        This method should not be invoked for non-local MRL's like streaming network addresses.

        Parameters:
        mediaPath - path to the local media
        parse - true if the media should be parsed immediately; otherwise false
        Returns:
        media meta data, or null if the media could not be located

      • newLog

        Create a new native log component.

        The native log requires vlc 2.1.0 or later.

        Returns:
        native log component, or null if the native log is not available

      • newMediaDiscoverer

        public MediaDiscoverer newMediaDiscoverer(String name)
        Create a new native media service discoverer.

        Not all media discoveres are supported on all platforms.

        Parameters:
        name - name of the required service discoverer, e.g. "audio", "video".
        Returns:
        native media discoverer component

      • newAudioMediaDiscoverer

        public MediaDiscoverer newAudioMediaDiscoverer()
        Create a new native audio media service discoverer.

        This method is simply a convenient wrapper around newMediaDiscoverer(String).

        Returns:
        native media discoverer component

      • newVideoMediaDiscoverer

        public MediaDiscoverer newVideoMediaDiscoverer()
        Create a new native video media service discoverer.

        This should return for example video capture devices currently attached to the system.

        This method is simply a convenient wrapper around newMediaDiscoverer(String).

        The video discoverer may not be available on all platforms.

        Returns:
        native media discoverer component

      • clock

        public long clock()
        Get the time as defined by LibVLC.

        The time is not meaningful in the sense of what time is it, rather it is a monotonic clock with an arbitrary starting value.

        Returns:
        current clock time value, in microseconds
